About the Team Workday's Enterprise AI Strategy and Product Management organization is a dynamic team that is spearheading Workday's AI strategy and product delivery by overseeing product strategy, technical delivery, AI governance, and product incubation. Equipped with an array of skills in data & AI platforms and architecture, data science, engineering, machine learning and AI strategy & product management, this team has a relentless focus on innovation and efficiency. The team's key objective is to empower our enterprise with strategic bets and innovative AI initiatives to deliver on the company's strategic growth objectives and we're looking for an AI Product Manager Intern who is enthusiastic about the potential of AI in transforming the way we work. About the Role We are seeking an AI product manager intern with a strategic product thinking and hands-on "builder" mindset. This role will challenge you to work across strategy, execution, and hands-on delivery in Workday's Enterprise AI Incubation Lab. • Define Product Strategy: Drive the AI product vision and strategy by collaborating with executive leadership and business unit owners to identify and qualify the highest-value opportunities for leveraging Generative AI, machine learning, and AI agents to reinvent core business processes. • Partner on Product Delivery: Collaborate deeply with AI/ML engineering, data science, and design teams to translate the product roadmap into detailed technical requirements, user stories, and acceptance criteria for both model development and application-layer UX. • Manage Business Case Lifecycle: Develop and own the business case for AI initiatives, defining key performance indicators (KPIs), estimating business impact, and establishing a continuous feedback loop to measure and report on ROI post-launch. • Groom Product Backlog: Own and manage the AI product backlog, translating ambiguous business problems into a prioritized roadmap of use cases, model improvements, and agent capabilities. • Conduct Market Evaluations: Serve as the internal subject matter expert on the applied AI landscape, continually assessing emerging trends, foundational models, MLOps vendors, and potential build-vs-buy or partnership opportunities. • Partner cross-functionally: Shepherd products from concept to launch by partnering with marketing, legal, and operations to define go-to-market strategies, enablement materials, and a data-driven process for iterating on post-launch performance and feature gaps. • Build and Test Rapid Prototypes: Rapidly develop proofs-of-concept (PoCs) and functional prototypes using Python, APIs, and low-code/no-code platforms to validate ideas and demonstrate the "art of the possible" to stakeholders. • Engage with Technical Details: Act as the bridge between the business vision and technical execution, comfortable diving into API documentation, assessing model performance metrics (e.g., accuracy, latency, cost-per-inference), and contributing to technical design discussions. • Drive User Adoption: Create and manage user feedback programs, acting as the primary point of contact to understand user pain points and evangelize the benefits of new AI-powered features.
